intro: Croton dracunculoides, commonly known as the African croton, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and striking, often colorful flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
